intro: Scalia microcephala, commonly known as the dwarf scalia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
